DataElement.preferredName: Preparative Regimen Planned Occurrence Administered Classification Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the planned preparative regimen administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The chemotherapy and/or radiation given to blood, marrow or cord blood transplant patients prior to transplant to kill diseased cells and/or make space for healthy new marrow and/or suppress the immune system so graft rejection does not occur._An instance of an event or incident that is intended to take place._The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The chemotherapy and/or radiation given to bone marrow transplant patients prior to transplant to kill diseased cells and/or make space for healthy new marrow and/or suppress the immune system so graft rejection does not occur.

Concepts.definition: The chemotherapy or radiation given prior to blood, marrow, cord blood transplant, or cell infusion to kill diseased cells and make space for the healthy new graft and/or suppress the immune system so rejection does not occur.

Property.preferredDefinition: An instance of an event or incident that is intended to take place.:The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

Concepts.definition: An instance of an event or incident that is intended to take place.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The chemotherapy and/or radiation given to blood, marrow or cord blood transplant patients prior to transplant to kill diseased cells and/or make space for healthy new marrow and/or suppress the immune system so graft rejection does not occur._A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: The administration of high-dose chemotherapy, with or without total body irradiation, to eradicate the underlying disease and/or ablate the immune system of the patient.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
The administration of high-dose chemotherapy, with or without total body irradiation, to eradicate the underlying disease and/or ablate the immune system of the patient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The administration of high-dose chemotherapy, with or without total body irradiation, to eradicate the underlying disease and/or ablate the immune system of the patient.

Concepts.definition: The administration of high-dose chemotherapy, with or without total body irradiation, to eradicate the underlying disease and/or ablate the immune system of the patient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Reduced; made less in size or amount or degree.: The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.

Concepts.definition: Made less in size or amount or degree.
The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The chemotherapy and/or radiation given to bone marrow transplant patients prior to transplant to kill diseased cells and/or make space for healthy new marrow and/or suppress the immune system so graft rejection does not occur.:A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: The chemotherapy or radiation given prior to blood, marrow, cord blood transplant, or cell infusion to kill diseased cells and make space for the healthy new graft and/or suppress the immune system so rejection does not occur.
A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
